you have hemophilia, you may bleed for a longer time than others after an injury. You also may bleed inside your body (internally), especially in your knees, ankles, and elbows. This bleeding can damage your organs and tissues and may be life threatening.
                
Overview
                
Hemophilia usually is inherited. ""Inherited means that the disorder is passed from parents to children through genes.
                
People born with hemophilia have little or no clotting factor. C
